Save yourself the headache of hearing absolute mind numbing garbage.

author: Rpgalltheway
content:
Spotify knows they keep making their product worse and worse, they have to know, they get bombarded with suggestions and requests because heavens forbid any tech company actually field real support and feedback, let's just leave it up to blogs and forums and let the consumers do the thinking for us. It seems Spotify has fully embraced the asinine trends of terrible US tech companies like Meta and Amazon.

I was finally prompted to actually write a review because of the most recent display update that added the annoying create button in the spot where Library used to be. Library is the primary screen most people use, and now the screen real estate is messed up for what reason? To put all the social features in one inconvenient place? I never have and never will want to use any of the create tools, and guess what they were all fine exactly where they were, never had any trouble finding them before. 

I also don't want to keep paying an increased subscription price for an app that can't load downloaded content correctly when the network is congested. There doesn't seem to be the common sense feature that if network speeds do not meet a certain threshold then toggle offline mode so people can still access offline content appropriately. Instead of having a bloated app that consumes too many resources that essentially crashes when the network speeds are good enough to navigate everything on the app but not good enough stream, making it so you still somehow can't access downloaded content because streaming can't happen and offline mode has to be toggled on to access it.

I also don't want to pay for audiobooks I never listen to, if you're trying to poach Audible subscribers the answer was to not subsidize the feature by making it seem like a beneficial extra to the base subscription and then upping the price. Make a music+audiobook subscription tier and have it cost $2 more than the base premium. Same with the new video hosting, I don't want to pay for Spotify's new video hosting servers, I want a dedicated quality music app and now the vision is clearly gone.

The only people that want what Spotify is currently doing are the executives that can get more money from even the worst ideas (because somehow even terribly implemented features = increased subscription price) and the people who believe them when they get told these are all good things. The amount of good ideas and feature requests and feature removal requests (looking at you smart shuffle) completely ignored on the forums exemplify that Spotify clearly does not care. 

All these features should be opt-in/toggle-able at the very least, and removed immediately for others.

This is a great time to start supporting artists directly, purchasing tracks so you can have them forever, and not rely on companies that make things consistently worse to dictate your experiences.
clean_content: spotify knows keep making product worse worse know get bombarded suggestions requests heavens forbid tech company actually field real support feedback let leave blogs forums let consumers thinking us seems spotify fully embraced asinine trends terrible us tech companies like meta amazon finally prompted actually write review recent display update added annoying create button spot library used library primary screen people use screen real estate messed reason put social features one inconvenient place never never want use create tools guess fine exactly never trouble finding also want keep paying increased subscription price app load downloaded content correctly network congested seem common sense feature network speeds meet certain threshold toggle offline mode people still access offline content appropriately instead bloated app consumes many resources essentially crashes network speeds good enough navigate everything app good enough stream making still somehow access downloaded content streaming happen offline mode toggled access also want pay audiobooks never listen trying poach audible subscribers answer subsidize feature making seem like beneficial extra base subscription upping price make music audiobook subscription tier cost base premium new video hosting want pay spotify new video hosting servers want dedicated quality music app vision clearly gone people want spotify currently executives get money even worst ideas somehow even terribly implemented features increased subscription price people believe get told good things amount good ideas feature requests feature removal requests looking smart shuffle completely ignored forums exemplify spotify clearly care features opt toggle able least removed immediately others great time start supporting artists directly purchasing tracks forever rely companies make things consistently worse dictate experiences

author: DSMSDBFORCEDS
content: I have been paying for Premium around nine years. Spotify wants to be a social media platform. Years ago, I used its algorithm as a discovery engine. It was decent. The fake AI stuff snuck up on me, and now Spotify feels as overrun with AI entities as Meta or any other dangerous internet space. It's starting to feel like a vanity publication. Artists, contributors, content providers be aware you're paying a social media platform to use your creative work any way it can. For these reasons, I don't see Spotify as creator, artist, or podcaster friendly. I don't think Joe Rogan pays for Spotify Creator or whatever the podcast product is now called. Spotify is still worth the approximately ten dollars per month I now pay  but if a similar app comes along that doesn't want to be another everything app like Meta, WeChat, or Amazon I might be jumping ship then.

author: Poignant Bubble
content:
Spotify, 

Next month, I will be walking away after 10 years with Spotify, because of poor choice after poor choice made by the Spotify team. Since having premium, i haven't listened to ads in 5 years, and after reading recent reviews it seems that those of us who have Free receive more ads than music. The whole "30 minutes of ad free music" followed by an ad 5 minutes later was happening 5 years ago too by the way. For one of the top two music apps in the world, with millions of users, you might think that the ads given would be justifiably less intrusive than they have to be, but Spotify has proven to be much more about profit than user experience. In the last year, i have noticed at least 7 major changes to the app interface, none of which has made my experience as a customer any easier. My humble onion, it started going downhill when you changed your font last year. As a long time user, of course i noticed. it bothered me, but it wasn't too much to bear. Fast forward to now, and i've even noticed a bug on the screen when opening the new "add" feature. Beloved Spotify employees. Why fix what ain't broke? Why make such bad choices when apple music pays artists more, and doesn't change UI that's been the same for 10+ years? Not everything needs an update, especially when people have been asking for you to bring back dated playlists and different 'sort by' options. I never, ever thought i'd change sides after going through "Spotify vs Apple Music" in HS. I always thought Spotify was superior, and I was wrong. I consider myself to be an A+ Spotify user, with 10 years and almost 1000 playlists with you, and if you don't listen to those who have supported you from the jump, why are you even still contributing? Just my $11.99 cents. Thanks for‚Ä¶ something Spotify. It's a big old shame. Also, Lockheed Martin? Lame and Loser behavior. Welcome to the wrong side of history! xx 

Sincerely, 
Disappointed.

author: PALLAV BORA
content: Spotify is an exceptional music streaming service that offers an unparalleled listening experience.
